intro: Hypocyrta crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved Hypocyrta, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hypocyrta crassifolia is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
